name: Mpelleiko Tradional House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Mpelleiko is a special place! Set in the quaint town of Stemnista, nestled in the mountains we found a traditional home from the 1600s that Nena Gkrinitzia has turned into a bed and breakfast. The house was Nena's grandparent's home and she has lovingly renovated the property while leaving in tact all of the charm. The house overlooks the town and mountains, and there are views from inside the home as well as the garden areas. The rooms themselves are large and nicely appointed. The house is decorated to reflect the traditions of the local area and also has all the modern conveniences. We stayed in the downstairs room which had a double and a single bed, a private entry way and a terrace with a view. Breakfast is served in the dining/sitting area which has a wonderful view and a homey atmosphere. Breakfast consisted of home made bread and marmalades, a kind of traditional dumpling filled with feta cheese and herbs as well as fruit and yogurt. Nena is a most gracious hostess and helped us plan our time in the area. She had great suggestions regarding hikes and sites to visit. The two nights we stayed here were the highlight of our time in Greece!
reviews.title: Lovely Traditional Bed and Breakfast in an Idyllic Setting

reviews.text: Nena is the most vivacious, wonderful host who makes you feel as if you're a personal guest in her very beautiful, authentic stone house. To stay here is to experience something unique; probably as close to the real thing as you can get as a tourist. The views to the mountains from the breakfast room and patios are glorious, the garden is lovely, the rooms are charming and the breakfasts are delicious. Nena, through her warmth & hospitality, created a place where her guests could get to know each other, enjoy wonderful conversations and relax into the beauty & peace of Mpelleiko. This is a wonderful part of the Peloponnese, a place of majestic beauty and far from the maddening crowd.
reviews.title: A special place of beauty & peace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great place!!!.. The house is charming. The dinnin room has an spectacular view and a peaceful ambience. The breakfast is great, very complet, with a diversity of homemade products, but the best of the site is Nena, the landlady: friendly, helpful, and giving a lot of very useful suggestions.
reviews.title: It's an excellent choice!!!

reviews.text: After having stayed at the Mbellaiko for our honeymoon two years ago my husband decided to take me along with our 13 month old daughter once again to Nena's place as a retreat from the sweltering greek summer.
reviews.title: 3 incredible days in the hospitality of Nena

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We absolutely loved it ! Nena's hospitality and care for the travellers that choose to stay at her place is as meticulous as ever.
reviews.title: An excellent B&B in a beautiful location

reviews.text: Her breakfasts are astounding and never the same each day. The cleanliness of the rooms is impeccable. The outdoor gardens extremely well kept. And Nena's knowledge of Stemnitsa and the surrounding area is a wonderful treat and demonstrates an individual who has a great love of her birthplace.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings about the place
Mpelleiko - outstanding accommodation in an exceptionall beautiful area of Greece!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Nice oasis of civility

reviews.text: "Mpelleiko" is Greek for Beautiful, or perhaps more appropriately "Gorgeous". considering Stemnitza's location high above the southern entrance to the Louisos Gorge. The Traditional House, its owner/operator, its rooms and common areas, its location overlooking Stemnitza, its outstanding hospitality, are exceptional in a region of the Peleponnese that is exceptionally beautiful in itself. We cannot too highly recommend a visit to Mpelleiko for any traveller exploring the Peleponnesse or Arcadia.
reviews.title: Whant to in winter

reviews.text: We chose to stay in Mpelleiko because of its proximity to the Louisos Gorge, and its location in Stemnitza, both of which we wanted very much to visit. We knew from other commentaries that Mpellieko had very favorable reviews. We did not know just how much those reviews understated the quality of accommodation that Mpelleiko provides. About 8 years ago, its owner, Nina Gkrintzia, a zoologist and teacher, left her position in Northern Greece, to return to Stemnitza and create "Mpelleiko" in what had been her family's home. "As a child, I loved the mountains and spent all my spare time hiking them," she told us. "When my father died, it seemed right to make "Mpelleiko" a place from which I could share my knowledge and love of the mountains, its people and their tradtions, with others. I have travelled enough, too, to know what makes a really outstanding experience for a traveller, and have really worked hard at including what I have learned into their visits to Stemnitza."
reviews.title: Quiet, Nice and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very special house. The moment you enter you feel at home. This is largely due to the owner Nena, which has renovated and operates her traditional family home with a lot of love and dedication. She is supported by her mother and her dog Glika.
reviews.title: A wonderful house with a soul

reviews.text: The house and the rooms (we choose the room of the donkey) are even better than described on the homepage. See the beautiful photos there! All is of very high quality and with a local flair. The view to the village Stemnitsa is breathtaking!
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the morning Nena cooked us a wonderful breakfast with local ingredients. According to the season we even got an omelet with wild aspargus!
reviews.title: A hidden gem in the lands of Arcadia!

reviews.text: We hiked from Gortys (ancient Asklepios shrine) in the Lousios valley to the monastery Prodromou, which "hangs" in the cliffs above the valley. An unforgettable experience!
reviews.title: Friendly and fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We traveled the Peloponnese on a five day whirlwind trip. My favorite stop of all was in Stemnitsa. Set in a hillside, this beautiful old town with character oozing from every corner, we arrived tired but excited. We chose to stay at Mpelleiko Traditional House from an Internet search followed by a Tripadvisor review check. We were delighted to find everything that has been said is true. Nena was so accommodating upon arrival and offered us tea, coffee or whatever we liked. Also on hand were some delicious homemade cookies. Our room was for my husband, step daughter (16) and me. It was spacious, immaculately clean and warm. The view from the terrace was awesome! Nena told us that Stemnitsa is home to a jewelry making school (we asked about how the economy was driven and one thing the area is known for is its jewelry), and there happened to be an exhibit in the nearby town of Dimitsana. We went there and were not disappointed at all. Not only did we visit a lovely little town, we were able to shop for reasonably priced jewelry made by local young people. In the morning, we were treated to the homemade jam another reviewer wrote of, and the spinach pies! Just a fabulous stay and we highly recommend it. If you are traveling through Stemnitsa, stay with Nena!
reviews.title: Spectacular, a true gem!

description: Traditional houses in the area of Stemnitsa, Mpelleiko as well, have got two floors, the ground floor called katoi and the first floor called anoi. On the ground floor there are two rooms, the principal room, to kyrios katoi, and the room of the donkey, to katoi tou gaidarou, which resulted from an extension of the building in the beginning of the 18th century. On the first floor there is the drawing room, i sala, the winter room, to himoniatiko, the chamber, i kamari , and the summer room, o ontas.
